meanings.definition: A loud and confused noise, especially one caused by a large group of people.
meanings.sent1: The uproar of the crowd at the concert was deafening.
meanings.sent2: The city was filled with uproar during the festival.
meanings.sent3: The uproar of the children playing outside was music to the ears of the parents.
meanings.sent4: The uproar of the storm outside matched the chaos in my mind.
meanings.sent5: The uproar of the fireworks lit up the night sky.

meanings.definition: A state of commotion or tumult.
meanings.sent1: There was an uproar in the classroom when the teacher announced a pop quiz.
meanings.sent2: The political scandal caused an uproar among the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The uproar in the kitchen over who ate the last cookie was both funny and dramatic.
meanings.sent4: The uproar in the market reflected the uncertainty of the economy.
meanings.sent5: The uproar in the jungle made it clear that danger was near.
